title: What Janet Yellen's nomination as Treasury secretary means for U.S. policy on China and trade
text: If confirmed for the job, former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen would be a critical figure in U.S. trade negotiations with China.

title: The Dow Rose 185 Points Because the Future Holds Stimulus and Vaccines
text: The market is hanging its hat on developments that support an economic recovery, beyond the recent choppy economic data. Steel makers Nucor and United States Steel saw shares rally.

title: Dollar hovers near 2-1/2 low as traders eye U.S. stimulus talks
text: The dollar stayed near a 2 1/2-year low on Wednesday as investors cautiously eyed developments in talks about further fiscal stimulus from the United States, while risk currencies held onto gains on improving risk appetite.

title: RBA's Lowe: Economy Is Recovering, But Will Be 'Bumpy'
text: Dec.01 -- Reserve Bank of Australia Governor Philip Lowe says the nation's economy has turned a corner from its pandemic-inducted downturn, while reiterating that the recovery is likely to be a bumpy one. He speaks to a parliamentary panel in Canberra.

title: Jim Cramer: The stay-at-home investing trend is not over
text: "Despite what you heard this morning, vast swathes of our economy remain very strong, and that includes the stay-at-home stocks," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell describes 'challenging winter,' for struggling areas of the economy
text: Yahoo Finance's Brian Cheung weighs in on the Fed's latest comments on a challenges to the economy amid the coronavirus pandemic and the outlook for the economy. Also, Brian breaks down the latest news on the Judy Shelton vote.

title: Credit Inflation Is On The Rise
text: The immediate reactions to the Biden economic policy appointments is that credit inflation is alive and well and is going to be very much a part of the future.

title: Nasdaq Wants Listed Companies to Have More Diverse Boards
text: Dec.01 -- Nasdaq Inc. plans to require more diversity on the boards of listed companies. This includes thousands of businesses.

text: Don't get caught unaware of what's happening behind the scenes.

title: U.S. Markets Rally to Kick Off December
text: Investors sprinted into December sending the S&P 500 to a new record high.

title: Bullish trends suggest there's a 100% chance the S&P 500 will see a positive December: Tom Lee

title: Stock futures flat after strong start to December
text: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite closed at record highs on Tuesday.

title: NASDAQ-listed companies, including truckers, face new rules on diversifying their boards
text: The NASDAQ stock exchange, home to numerous publicly traded trucking and logistics firms, is seeking government approval of a rule that would require more diversity on the corporate boards that govern companies traded on it. The proposal made to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) would require the companies trading on NASDAQ to have “at least two” directors described as diverse.

title: Large Caps Are Positioning To Take The Lead (Technically Speaking For 12/1)
text: Intermarket activity is bullish. Chinese manufacturing has fully rebounded. Small caps are cooling; large caps might take the lead.

title: Stocks Hit Record Highs As Nasdaq Cleans Up Its Chart Swiftly
text: Fresh from an outstanding month of November, the stock market began December in excellent shape, with the Nasdaq composite and S&P 500 making record highs. The post Stocks Hit Record Highs As Nasdaq Cleans Up Its Chart Swiftly appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: $908 Billion Bipartisan Coronavirus Bill Met With Counterproposal From Senate Republicans
text: A long-running battle over the stalled sequel to the spring's $2 trillion coronavirus relief package is heating up again in Washington, according to a report from Bloomberg. A bipartisan group of lawmakers proposed a $908 billion stimulus package on Tuesday (Dec. 1) that was rejected later by Sen.

title: Recovery Still Uncertain, Needs Continued Fiscal Support: OECD
text: The international organization sees the world economy growing 4.2% next year after falling by a similar amount in 2020.

title: Economists Watch for Signs of Double-Dip Recession.
text: Competing variables could determine whether the U.S. economy swings into full recovery or back into recession. Retail sales for the holidays were strong, but so is the impact of a new Covid-19 wave on jobs and consumer confidence.

title: World Stock Indices Hit New Highs As Equity Inflows Surge
text: Every week there are plenty of interesting and eye-catching stock market charts, indicators and statistics that we could spend our time mulling over in private or talking about with friends and colleagues. Some of these are noise, some are worthy of further consideration.

title: Evercore's Altman on Stimulus, Biden, U.S. Economy
text: Dec.01 -- Roger Altman, chairman and founder at Evercore, discusses the state of the U.S. economy, the four things that need to be included in the next round of stimulus, and how corporate America views President-elect Joe Biden. He speaks with Bloomberg's David Westin on “Balance of Power.

title: Real interest rates will fall as we move into recovery, weighing on the U.S. dollar: Evercore ISI vi
text: Krishna Guha, Evercore ISI head of global policy and central bank strategy, joins 'Closing Bell' to talk about his outlook on the U.S. dollar index and Janet Yellen as the new Treasury secretary.

title: US Indexes Close With Gains to Start December
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 29,823.92 on Tuesday with a gain of 185.28 points or 0.63%. The S&P 500 closed at 3,662.45 for a gain of 40.82 points or 1.13%.

title: Stock Market Today: Wall Street Hangs on Stimulus Hopes Again
text: Stocks kicked off the month of December by resuming their November form, rushing out of the gate to solid gains as COVID stimulus, left for dead in the weeks before and after the election, suddenly came back into play Tuesday. A bipartisan group of lawmakers laid out a $908 billion plan with funds for Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans, supplemental unemployment benefit funding, and state and local government aid, though no direct stimulus checks like this spring's CARES Act.

title: Stocks jump on new stimulus hopes; S&P, Nasdaq hit record closes
text: FOX Business' Jackie DeAngelis reports the latest on the markets. #FoxBusiness Subscribe to Fox Business!

title: Stocks Buoyed by Manufacturing Data and Vaccine Optimism
text: A survey showed that Chinese factory activity accelerated at the fastest pace in a decade last month, spurring a rally in Asian stocks.

title: Powell Says Economic Outlook Is 'Extraordinarily Uncertain'
text: Dec.01 -- Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell cautioned lawmakers that the U.S. economy remains in a damaged and uncertain state despite progress made in the development of Covid-19 vaccines. He spoke before the Senate Banking Committee.

title: Treasury Secretary Mnuchin faces harsh criticism from Democratic senators over ending Fed programs
text: The Treasury secretary cited portions of the law that said he didn't have the authority to allow Fed programs to run past the end of 2020.

title: S&P 500 and Nasdaq close at record highs as investors bet that a vaccine will drive an economic rebound
text: US stocks gained on Tuesday as vaccine progress continued to lift stocks battered the most by the coronavirus pandemic. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite closed at record highs. Pfizer and BioNTech applied for regulatory approval for their vaccine in the European Union; if approved, the shot could begin to be distributed before the new year.

title: Endgame afoot on Capitol Hill as lawmakers mull fiscal stimulus, funding, defense bills
text: Headed into the home stretch of the legislative work year, lawmakers on Tuesday began mulling how to wrap up Congress's three main priorities --- another big coronavirus financial aid bill, funding for the rest of the government's budget year, and an annual defense policy bill.

title: Airbnb targets $34.8bn valuation in Wall Street float
text: Airbnb is aiming for a valuation of up to $34.8bn (£25.5bn) when it floats in New York next week after a swift recovery in its fortunes in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Senate GOP Covid relief proposal would take back $429B in unused funds for Fed lending
text: The Republican Senate's Covid relief proposal would take back $429 billion dollars and repurpose it, some for small business. Ylan Mui joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss details on the proposal.

title: Mnuchin, Pelosi to Discuss Stimulus Package
text: Here's what you need to know about the impact of Covid-19 to navigate the markets today.

title: S&P 500, Nasdaq Composite clinch record closes Tuesday to start first session in December
text: U.S. stock benchmarks on Tuesday ended solidly higher, though off their richest levels of the session. The gains, however, were enough to register an all-time closing high for the S&P 500 index and the Nasdaq Composite Index , as the optimism behind the November market rally extended into a new month and investors appeared to pin bullishness on the day to hope for further fiscal relief from Washington, even if the roadmap to get there appears unclear, to combine with progress on progress on vaccine candidates.

title: The Nasdaq Doesn't Need Zoom to Set New Record Highs
text: Investors are shifting their views beyond the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: McConnell rejects bipartisan $900 billion coronavirus stimulus plan
text: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell rejected a new bipartisan $908 billion stimulus plan put forward in an effort to break the legislative stalemate as the coronavirus surges throughout the country, and small businesses and the unemployed take the brunt of the blow.

title: Currencies: Why the U.S. dollar is trading at a 2 1/2-year low

title: Election End + Vaccine Victory? = Dow 30,000
text: There are many variables that affect the direction of the stock market, but there were two factors that pushed the stock market to a record high of 30,000 on the Dow Jones Industrial Average. The mathematical equation solved last month was the following: (Election End + Positive Vaccine Data) = Dow 30,000.

title: Lawmakers just unveiled a $908 billion coronavirus stimulus deal that would boost unemployment payments and help small businesses. Here's what's in the package.
text: Sixteen lawmakers from both parties are taking the gridlock over a coronavirus stimulus into their own hands.   They unveiled a $908 billion stimulus deal on Tuesday that they hope can get passed before Congress leaves for its winter break, and can provide relief until April 1 even as the pandemic shows no sign of slowing.
